Package pbxuniverse

Class PBXDataChannel

java.lang.Object
pbxuniverse.PBXChannel
pbxuniverse.PBXDataChannel
Direct Known Subclasses:
PBXChannelAPA102, PBXChannelAPAClock, PBXChannelWS2812
public class PBXDataChannel extends PBXChannel
Container class for all Pixelblaze Output Expander (PBX) data channels, including channels for all LED types and clock data.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    float
    getBrightness()
    Gets brightness value (range 0..1) for this channel.
    int
    getPixelCount()
    Returns total number of pixels attached to this channel
    void
    setBrightness​(float b)
    Sets brightness for this channel.
    void
    setColorCorrection​(float r, float g, float b)
    Sets r,g and b color correction factors -- per color component "multipliers" in the range (0..1) that will be multplied with pixel colors to produce, at full brightness, the particular 'white' you want to match.
    void
    setDrawMode​(DrawMode dm)
    Sets pixel drawing mode, either DrawMode.FAST (brightness & gamma adjustment only) or DrawMode.ENHANCED (brightness, gamma, color correction, color depth expansion if supported by LEDs).
    void
    setGammaCorrection​(float g)
    Sets gamma correction factor (power curve exponenent) for this channel.

  • Method Details

    • getPixelCount

      public int getPixelCount()
      Returns total number of pixels attached to this channel
      Returns:

    • setDrawMode

      public void setDrawMode​(DrawMode dm)
      Sets pixel drawing mode, either DrawMode.FAST (brightness & gamma adjustment only) or DrawMode.ENHANCED (brightness, gamma, color correction, color depth expansion if supported by LEDs). DrawMode can be changed at any time.

    • setBrightness

      public void setBrightness​(float b)
      Sets brightness for this channel.
      Parameters:
      b - (0..1) brightness

    • getBrightness

      public float getBrightness()
      Gets brightness value (range 0..1) for this channel.

    • setGammaCorrection

      public void setGammaCorrection​(float g)
      Sets gamma correction factor (power curve exponenent) for this channel.
      Parameters:
      g - global gamma factor (0..1)

    • setColorCorrection

      public void setColorCorrection​(float r, float g, float b)
      Sets r,g and b color correction factors -- per color component "multipliers" in the range (0..1) that will be multplied with pixel colors to produce, at full brightness, the particular 'white' you want to match.
